runs.comm: full, just outside off, defended off the front foot
full again, just outside off, driven back at Mooney who sticks his right hand out to field
slight movement in from wide on the crease, defended to mid-on
overpitched again, but driven straight to mid-on this time
another firmish drive, and he finds mid-on again
full, outside off, driven towards mid-off, but Mooney's dive doesn't let it reach mid-off
starts with a wide down the leg side. Would have been a perfect outswinger to a right-hand batsman
full, on the pads, clipped away for one
wide outswinger, slightly harsh to call it a wide. This one starts well within the tram lines, and swings away
this is closer to off, left alone, not called a wide
mid-on is wide, this half-volley is too full and straight, he just meets it with a straight bat, and pushes it through mid-on
another half-volley, on off, crunched back to him
third wide of the over. Swings early and swings a long way away
uppish. Wide length ball, he drives hard at it, fails to keep it down, but it is desperately wide of the diving Porterfield at point
half-volley, outside off, driven to mid-off. A long over comes to an end
short of a length, around off, punched to cover-point
half-volley, just outside off, driven straight to mid-off

they have all gone up, it is not given out, and they review it. Mooney goes wide on the wicket, angles this across the body of de Kock, this one pitches leg, squares de Kock up, leaves him - there is seam movement apart from the angle - there is a soft sound as the ball passes the bat, and you can see a deflection too. A smidgeon on the snicko as the ball passes the outside edge. De Kock will be on his way. And yes, the decision has been overturned
wide on the crease, angles a length ball in, pushed to mid-on
full, really full, outside off, dug out towards mid-off
floated up outside off, left alone - Mooney 2-2-0-1 - I don't see anyone scoring a run off him
and this time Sorensen is wided down the leg side to a right-hand batsman. Needs to find some control
wide half-volley, driven with an open face, gets a single to third man
short and wide, and too wide. Five wides. Almost like he has the yips
half-volley just outside off, driven to mid-off
this time a big wide down the leg side
finally pitches one, but it is a wide length ball that has been driven through extra cover for four
short of a length, outside off, half-cut to cover
length ball, outside off, he dabs it past the first slip for a single to third man
full, on the pads, clipped away, but straight to square leg
first runs off Mooney as he provides a leg-side half-volley, which has been flicked away
wide half-volley, driven away, but straight to cover-point

lovely delivery. Goes wide on the crease, not quite a half-volley, which means he is not quite to the pitch of it. Then Faf has to play the angle, but this one swings away late to beat the edge. Deserves a wicket
too straight, clipped away off the toe for one
full outside off, flicked away to mid-off
short of a length, angled in, tucked away off the hip for one

dropped first ball. This one has luck-of-the-Irish written all over it until Ed Joyce has spilled it. A length ball, on the pads, asking to be hit, Amla whips it, but straight to short midwicket. Bursts through Joyce's hands, and hits him on the thigh
short and wide, cut away for one
dabbed away towards third man
short and wide again, cut in front of square, between point and cover-point, and the outfield is quick
wide length ball, driven superbly between cover and mid-off. That's four
and now Amla can afford to open the face and run this down to third man
short of a length, angling in, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, angling in towards the top of off, defended back to him
shorter this time, and pulled to long leg
on a length, angling in, Faf is squared up a touch and defends
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
called a wide outside off, but the umpire has disregarded that du Plessis has moved a long way across even before the bowler has delivered
on a length, just outside off, defended
gentle length ball, punch driven on the up, between the bowler and mid-on, all along the ground
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for one
opens the face on this length ball to take a single
short of a length, holds up a touch, pushed to mid-on
there is only a small gap in this cover ring. Short cover has a cover almost right behind him, but Amla has threaded this drive off a length ball through that "almost"
on a length, not quite full enough to drive, defended off the front foot
short of a length, into the pads, punched away wide of deep midwicket for two
short of a length, outside off, punched but finds short cover
slower ball, angling into the pads, defended towards the mid-on
short of a length, angling in towards the top of off, pushed to cover
full wide ball, he drives, but just can't get it past short cover
gets across to a wide length ball, bunts it into the leg side for a single
on a length, no turn, defended back to him
short, on off, but du Plessis makes room and cuts this between point and cover-point for four
short of a length again, punched this time, can't beat the man at cover
better, tossed up a little, gets some dip, defended to cover
on a length, on off, pushed wide of cover-point for a single
this one drifts back in upon pitching outside off, punched away, but not past the diving man at cover
looks to work this to leg, from well outside off, ends up playing it to cover
driven to long-on for one
overpitched, clipped off the toes for one
a length ball, into the pads, punched away past the diving midwicket

between the keeper and the slip. Both batsmen have had a life now. This is the drift, doesn't turn, Faf looking to cut gets a healthy outside edge, but O'Brien at first slip is already up and hasn't reacted in time. Fair to say that it is a really difficult chance, and that O'Brien is up already because he has seen the batsman shape up for the cut shot
flat, into the stumps, defended
on a length, straightens a touch, defended to cover
down the wicket to push this full ball to long-on for one
flatter, punched away down to long-on for a single
flat length ball, no turn, pushed back to him
flighted around off, driven to mid-off
stays full, gets some dip, Amla drives this back at the bowler
on a length, outside off, defended from the crease
looks for a paddle sweep from outside off, but succeeds in only playing it into his own pad
full, around off, he moves across to get inside its line and work it to deep midwicket
driven away on the up, straight of deep cover, comes back for two
Amla looks for another drive on the off side, this time more vigorously, but the ball is n't quite full enough, and beats him outside edge
moves across his stumps to punch this down to long-on for one

down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, pushes it defensively back to Dockrell, but the ball has hit the edge of the pitch and turned away from Dockrell and goes softly towards long-on, which means they come back for two
defended, but no edge-of-the-pitch stuff this time
down the wicket to drive this half-volley to long-on
flighted around off, defended on the off side
driven with an open face, looks like a regulation single wide of mid-off, but the mid-off is wide, and they are caught by surprise. Back in time, though
short of a length, no room, punched back at him
flat offbreak into the pads, punched to short midwicket
lovely square drive. Wide length ball, he is on front foot, but his strong wrists send this drive square through point for four
driven to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, turning in, turned away to midwicket
into the pads again, turned around the corner for one
wide length ball, pushed square on the off side for one
flat again, punched down to long-on for one
drops this in short, and Faf has easily pulled this over midwicket. Dockrell has not been bold today. Bowling flat and defensively
this time he flights it up, worked to leg for one
low full toss on the pads, played more square than he intends to, and finds square leg
driven to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, gets some dip, pushed to cover
on a length, outside off, pushed back at McB
too short, and Amla cuts him square of deep cover. A dive there saves a run, but Amla has brought up yet another fifty
pushed into the leg side, with the turn, for a single
whipped away to deep square leg for one
tossed up wide outside off, he waits for it to fall and then turn, and then opens the face at the last moment with the drive, and gets it past slip
length ball, outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
down the wicket to drive Dockrell to long-on
Dockrell continues to be short, and Faf rocks back to pull him over midwicket
fuller now, around off, defended off the front foot
down the wicket, Dockrell gives it a bit of hang time, and du Plessis defends this back
down the wicket again, and drives this to long-on for one
short again, cut away, McBrine saves four with a dive at point
offbreak, into the pads, worked to square leg
full, middle and leg, clipped away to deep square leg
short, punched away to deep cover
short of a length, quick, played to the short straight midwicket
slower through the air, higher in the flight, outside off, played with an open face, straight to point
pushed through this time, du Plessis drives at it, gets a thick edge past slip
and their spinners are bowling short. Du Plessis rocks back, and pulls this with a vertical bat, over midwicket for another four
punched down to long-on to bring up 100 for the partnership
another punch down to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, pushed to cover-point
short again and even though it holds its line, he has cut it to deep cover for a single to bring up his fifty
short again, cut away again, gets away with just a single to deep cover
tossed up on off, pushed to short midwicket
wristed away to deep square leg for a single
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball but still drops it into the leg side for a single
flighted outside off, dips on him, pushed to extra cover
short of a length, pushed to extra cover again
driven to long-on for one
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to mid-on
full, on off, driven, but can't beat mid-off
short, wide, and a very un-Amla-like slug off the front foot. An old-fashioned slog to send this between the bowler and mid-off
short and wide again, and cut away in the air, gets a single to deep cover-point
bad bounce off a practice pitch there. This seems like defended to short midwicket, but it bounces funnily and goes over the man for a single
Porterfield has definitely saved more than one here. Short of a length, wide, punched away, but Porterfield's dive at cover denies them
tossed up, middle and leg, bunted between backward square and forward square
tossed up, driven hard, but straight to long-on. Amla has introduced some power to shots over the last couple of overs
drops this in short but this time he has a deep midwicket in place to keep them down to one
length ball, turning back in towards top of off, punched to deep cover for one
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, defends this
looks to go back and force this, but the ball is a touch too full and hits the bottom edge
Amla is looking ominous. He has been tuning the band up. Moves across to a length ball outside off, and slogs this length ball over wide long-on for a six
this is a beautiful shot. A wide length ball, this time he stands his ground and inside-outs it over cover. Top-class chip
... but that won't help Ireland if they keep dropping short and wide. Amla has cut this away for four
punches this length ball to long-on for one

now du Plessis gets into the act. South Africa might be on to some record total today. Down the wicket, gets under a length ball, chips this over long-on for six. Sorensen has brought up his fifty already
length ball outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
swept away from outside off, and sends it over square leg for four. Oh my, this is looking ominous
length ball outside off, drops this into the covers for one
pushed towards deep midwicket for one
on a length, outside off, played with the turn, gets a single
driven against the turn, but finds extra cover
flat offbreak, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, on off, punched away for a single to deep point
on a length, on off, turning away, defended off the back foot
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, plays it to short straight midwicket
driven to long-on for one
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, du Plessis finds cover with this punch shot
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to short straight midwicket
flat outside off, punched to deep cover for one
gets down on a knee and wide outside off, and ramps this over the keeper's head
punched away to deep cover
driven to long-on for one
stays back to punch a length ball to deep cover-point
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to short straight midwicket
down the wicket, Dockrell holds it back, defended back to him
short of a length, he has chipped this off the back foot and over cover for two
down the wicket, Dockrell pulls back the length, and draws a cramped shot from du Plessis
flighted on middle and leg, driven to long-on
down the wicket, not quite to its pitch, and defends
length ball, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
driven against the turn, but the dive at extra cover keeps the runs down. Lovely fielding from KOB
KOB at it again, another extra-cover drive, and he dives and fields, and throws the stumps direct. Amla is back in
pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, outside off, pushed to deep cover
tossed up outside off, driven to long-off for one
flat length ball, into the pads, defended to short straight midwicket
short and wide, cut away to deep cover
pitched up, middle and leg, clipped away to deep midwicket for a single
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
flat shortish delivery, punched down to long-on
punched down to long-off for one
short of a length, turning in, punched to deep cover for one
pushed away past point for a single
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
down the wicket to work this to deep square for a single
pushed to long-off for a single this time
effortless. Sees that the mid-off is up, and chips this full ball over mid-off. Hardly any back lift or follow-through. Just a check drive. And it reaches the boundary triangles on the half-volley
on a length, offbreak, outside off, pushed towards cover
driven on the up, past the diving fielder at short cover
turning into the pads, worked away past midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, punched away, but straight to cover-point
full, into the pads, gets a single to deep midwicket
makes room fairly early, and punches this from outside leg, gets a single to deep cover
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to long-on
there he is, the fastest man to 20 ODI hundreds. Driven to long-off. Serenely accepts the applause from all around
makes room, Stirling follows him, cramps him up
down the wicket to drive this to mid-off for one
tossed up outside off, punched down to long-off for one
lovely shot. Makes room to drop this over mid-off, which comes up every time du Plessis comes on strike. Just an effortless chip shot over that man
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
slower through the air, du Plessis waits for it to turn, gets a single past point
overpitched, driven to long-off for one
down the wicket to push this towards long-on, short midwicket dives in, but pushes it away for a single
slow, high, loopy, defended back to him
fired into the pads to protect his over, and does so well. Pushed to short straight midwicket
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
driven to deep cover

mix-up. Amla's call as this is turned to square leg, but du Plessis sends him back rightly. The throw comes to the keeper, which allows Amla time to dive back into the crease and them jump uo for an overthrow as Wilson lobs this over the bowler's head
driven to long-off
flat outside off, pushed back to the bowler
down the wicket to drive this to long-on
down the wicket, not quite to its pitch, drops this to leg for one that brings up 200 for this stand
short and wide, cut away to sweeper-cover for one
down the wicket, looks to go to long-on, but finds the short straight midwicket, McBrine
still stuck on 99. Pushed to cover-point
slower through the air, he lets it come on, closes his bat face, drops it into the leg side for a single that brings up his hundred
moves across the stumps to drill this towards midwicket where a dive from McBrine keeps them down to one
wide and full, driven straight to deep cover for two
wide length ball, driven over point for four. That's poor bowling with all his protection down the ground
driven to long-off after making room. Gets a single
follows him with a full ball as he makes room, but he has still managed to get this wide of long-on for two
nice yorker following him as he makes room. Can't do much with him

that's an unfair shot. He looks to ramp this over fine leg, and O'Brien does him in with a wide length ball, but he pulls out the reverse ramp and sends it over a very straight third man. Incredible shot
short of a length, angling in, the keeper is up, he looks to hit this over cover where there are no riders, but is beaten by the extra bounce
bowling to hid field. Really full and just outside off with the long-off out. Amla hits this straight of that man, and comes back for the second
slower length ball, he gets inside the line of the ball, stays low so that he can pull it, and over square leg he sends it
full toss outside off. High full toss too. and he has sent it over cover. No deep fielders on the off side apart from long-off
it's gone awfully wrong for Mooney now. He has his deep fielders down the ground and he drops this short, and Amla pulls him over square leg for a six
short of a length, wide, no deep man on the off side other than long-off. Rules are stacked against them, but this is ordinary bowling still. Over point for four

wide length ball, and Amla effortlessly drives this inside-out over extra cover for a six. Mooney before this over: 5-2-9-1. After the over: 6-2-36-1. Might want to share a drink with WI captain Jason Holder
looks for the ramp, KOB goes wide, he wants the reverse ramp, but is beaten
gets the ramp right this time. Moves across early, KOB bowls length at the stumps, and he sends this over short fine. Third man - Dockrell - races across and does the sweeping
full and wide, driven to long-off for one

full toss and he is bowled. Actually more a yorker than a full toss. At least one double has been taken out of the equation. He is making room, KOB stays full and straight, it dips on him to land halfway between the crease and the stumps. He has missed this altogether. KOB gets into a shadow-boxing celebration with the disturbed stumps. A bit like footballers with the corner flag
down the wicket first ball, the ball is shorter than he wants it so he steers it to third man for one
full, outside off, driven inside-out, double knock-on, first by extra cover, then by mid-off who has been wrong-footed by extra cover. They get a couple
this is a decent delivery. Full, on middle and leg. No room. Can't really get under it. But AB has still made room and chipped it over cover for four

swept for six. Takes this from outside off, McBrine at deep forward square leg loses the ball in the air after he starts running to his right. In the end he just throws his arm at it in hope, but there is only despair for Ireland
low full toss, driven wide of long-off for two
makes room, Dockrell follows him with short quick delivery, he edges it towards long-off for one
moves across to slug this chest-high full toss between mid-on and midwicket. Never sure what rule for no-ball with full tosses for spinners is, but this one hasn't been called
this one dips a little, gets the inside edge on the slog
length ball outside off, driven wide of long-off, the fumble allows him to come back for a second to bring up the 150. Shakes AB's hand, half-raises the bat
moves across the stumps, takes this short ball from well outside off and pulls this between short fine leg and square leg. That's Amla's personal best
full and wide, and he has crunched a square drive past the diving Stirling at backward point. Seems all too easy for Amla
slower ball, a yorker, middle and leg, turned around for a single
AB is just unstoppable. A length ball outside off, and he has driven this over extra cover for a six. Yet to face a dot
good ball goes for two. De Villiers moves across his stumps, O'Brien bowls a yorker, but he somehow gets the bottom of the bat to it to send it fine of fine leg for a couple

there won't be a double today. Well bowled by McBrine. He holds this back, slow in the air, Amla charges down the wicket, is not quite to the pitch of the ball, and ends up lofting this to long-off where, some 200 runs after he first dropped Amla, Joyce completes the catch
flat, into the pads, played straight of deep square, comes back for the second

McBrine has two in one over and has put an end to the possibility of the falling of a plethora of records. De Villiers looks for the reverse sweep from the leg-stump line, gets a top edge, and backward point runs back to take the catch. This is the first ball AB has failed to score off
pushed to long-off for a single
tossed up, pushed to long-off for a single again
full toss on the pads, swept away, a bit of a top edge but it almost goes for a six over square leg. No man patrolling the boundary there
on a length, outside off, driven to deep cover for one
wide on the crease, bowls length, driven straight of long-on for a couple
full, on the pads, clipped wide of deep midwicket for another couple
slower short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket for one
down the wicket and making the room, Mooney follows him, there is no room, but he has chipped this into the gap in the leg side for a couple
oh he has overstepped. Full, on the pads, and worked away. A marginal no-ball. He is hiding his face behind his shirt after having bowled that
short ball, tired ball, on off, and he has pulled it over midwicket for a six
short, into the pads, helped along to fine leg for four. There is no fielder there
moves away from the stumps, Stirling stays full and straight, he takes a single to leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
swept from in front of the stumps, gets it fine of short fine leg, comes back for three
makes room to go over cover, Stirling bowls flat and quick, he gets a big outside edge fine of short third. And they run hard
shows him the reverse, Stirling stays full and straight, and he drives it to long-on
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
wide length ball, driven down to long-off for one
slower ball, on a length, pitches outside leg with both square leg and fine leg in the circle. Asking for trouble. Gives away four
finally a dot ball. Rossouw is down the wicket to drive this down the ground. KOB fields overhead and tries to run him out. Misses the stumps. Rossouw is gone if this hits
shows his the reverse without committing to it, and gets full toss on the pads and places it between long-on and deep midwicket
low full toss, driven to extra cover for one
length ball, into the pads, takes a single to long-on

Miller is sure he has hit this and has immediately reviewed this. He is looking to sweep and according to Steve Davis he has missed altogether a full and straight and fast ball and caught dead in plumb. Miller and reality have other ideas. He has smashed this with his inside edge. Overturned
makes room to try to drive this low full toss square. Can't beat point. Two dots in a row
fired into the pads, straight to short fine leg. Another dot
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
soft hands to push this towards long-on, but they decide against coming back for the second. Superb over by Stirling
yorker outside off, pushed wide of extra cover for one
low full toss outside off, bat face closes on the drive, gets a single to long-on
misses the yorker, this is a length ball, and Rossouw has lofted it over midwicket for a six
driven to deep cover, he slips just before turning, has to contend with a single
low full toss, wide outside off, can't beat short third, gets a single
wide low full toss, gets an inside edge back onto his body
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
well bowled. Stays slow even if Rossouw steps out. Beaten and hit on the pad
lovely bowling. A yorker outside leg following his movement away from the stumps
he finally gets it right, gets down to a length ball and lofts it straight of long-on for a flat six
well bowled, followsing him a she moves away from the stumps, but he has gone a touch too leg side and Rossouw gets an underside edge to send this fine of short fine leg
full toss on the pads but he has reverse-swept this straight to point
yorker, perfect dipping yorker, dug out back to him
makes room, Sorensen follows him, bowls full, but not quite a yorker, and Miller slugs this past midwicket for four
oh you don't bowl that to Miller. Full without being a yorker and wide outside off. Drilled away to deep cover for four
slower ball, highish fullie, he tries to sweep it and misses. Wilson concedes a bye as this dips
Rossouw tries the sweep too, but he has bowled the slower ball and outdone him completely. Toe-ended back to the bowler
high full toss. That's clearly a no-ball. A beamer. and he has incredibly hit it over extra cover for four. Just a flat-bat over the fielder

low full toss, nearly a yorker, mis-hit between long-on and long-off. Gives him time to come back for the second. Brings up a fifty off 27 balls. He is cementing his place in the side for the time Duminy comes back. Behardien might have to make way
that's death wish. Gentle pace, half-volley. Miller gets under it and slogs it over midwicket for a six. Superb running catch in the crowd by a bloke in pink
wide length ball, you can't bowl those even though the three conceded here are off an underside edge past the keeper
there is the 400. O'Brien bowls full without bowling a yorker, and he has lofted this over midwicket to make South Africa the first team to post 400 in back-to-back ODIs
gives him the charge, O'Brien goes wide, Rossouw throws his bat at it, gets an outside edge that beats short third man
finally a ball they can't get under. Full and wide outside off, dug out for a single to long-off
length again, he looks to slog it, gets an inside edge between the stumps and the keeper, and KOB lets out a yelp of frustration, but he shouldn't be bowling length in the first place
